description: For nearly two months, a mystery has stood at the center of the investigation of Michael D. Cohen, President Trumps longtime personal fixer: What exactly did the government find when federal agents raided Mr. Cohens office, apartment and hotel room in April?

title: Trump Exaggerates Trade Deficit With European Union by $50 Billion
description: Mr. Trumps numbers are off. The European Union had a $153 billion trade surplus in goods with the United States in 2017 and a total trade surplus of $101 billion when trade in services is included.

title: Daughter Sues Father for Trying to Block Sale of a Basquiat
description: A daughter sued her father, a major art collector, Thursday, saying he had intentionally depressed the price of a major Basquiat sold at auction last month with a failed and frivolous lawsuit to stop the sale.

title: Charm City, Part 1: Baltimore After Freddie Gray
description: A year after the death of Freddie Gray, a teenager known as Nook was shot and killed by a police officer. Nooks family seeks truth from the streets where he died and the city that wont give them answers.

title: Charm City, Part 2: The Legacy of Zero-Tolerance Policing
description: Relations between the police and the community in Baltimore werent always so troubled. But as job loss and drugs tore through the city, a policing idea called zero tolerance led to a breakdown in trust.

title: Sterling Brown to File Civil Rights Lawsuit After More Videos of Arrest
description: A lawyer for Sterling Brown, the Milwaukee Bucks player who was subdued with a stun gun following a parking violation, said he intended to file a federal civil rights lawsuit on Mr. Browns behalf.

title: Charm City, Part 3: The Lure of the Streets
description: Nook spent the first years of his life in an affluent suburb. But when he returned to Baltimore, he became part of a young generation caught between the crack epidemic and the aggressive police tactics meant to fix the problem.

title: Charm City, Part 4: The Police Scandal That Shook Baltimore
description: Nooks mother, Toby, had long ago lost faith in the Baltimore police. And as the department tried to repair its public image, a corruption trial exposed the depths of misconduct: An elite group of officers had been stealing from residents.

title: With Mueller Closing In, Manaforts Allies Abandon Him
description: WASHINGTON  The special counsels accusation this week that Paul Manafort, President Trumps former campaign chairman, tried to tamper with potential witnesses originated with two veteran journalists who turned on Mr. Manafort after working closely with him to prop up the former Russia-aligned president of Ukraine, interviews and documents show.

title: Ex-Senate Aide Charged in Leak Case Where Times Reporters Records Were Seized
description: WASHINGTON  A former Senate Intelligence Committee aide was arrested on Thursday in an investigation of classified information leaks where prosecutors also secretly seized years worth of a New York Times reporters phone and email records.

title: HGTVs Chip and Joanna Gaines Will Pay Fine Over Lead Paint Violations
description: Chip and Joanna Gaines, the stars of the HGTV television show Fixer Upper, have settled with the United States Environmental Protection Agency over allegations that they violated rules for the safe handling of lead paint during home renovations.

title: Justice Dept. Says Crucial Provisions of Obamacare Are Unconstitutional
description: WASHINGTON  The Trump administration told a federal court on Thursday that it would no longer defend crucial provisions of the Affordable Care Act that protect consumers with pre-existing medical conditions.

title: Corrections: June 8, 2018
description: NATIONAL

title: What Feelings Sound Like
description: Music can transport us back in time or help usher in new ways of thinking. It can capture a historical moment or offer an escape from the world around us.

title: Review: In Wilder Gone, the Pull of Soil, Soul and Preacher Sex
description: The theater company Clubbed Thumb says its mission is to develop and produce funny, strange and provocative new plays by living American writers.

title: Argentina Reaches $50 Billion Financing Deal With I.M.F.
description: BUENOS AIRES  Argentina reached a three-year deal with the International Monetary Fund on Thursday for a $50 billion credit line, an amount that was larger than expected, which the government promoted as a vote of confidence on its market-friendly reforms.

title: Hanging Around in a Deli
description: FRIDAY PUZZLE  It was that center square that kept bothering me as I solved Caleb Madisons puzzle. There was lots to like about his crossword, but it just didnt perform that high-wire act I like to see in our first themeless grid of the week.

title: House Votes to Trim Unused Funding, a Gesture of Fiscal Restraint
description: WASHINGTON  With annual budget deficits nearing $1 trillion, the House took a modest step on Thursday to broadcast fiscal responsibility, narrowly approving a White House plan to rescind nearly $15 billion in unspent funding that had been approved in past years.

title: The Washington Capitals, After Years of Frustration, Win the Stanley Cup
description: LAS VEGAS  Across their 43 seasons, the Washington Capitals dabbled in hapless hockey and exquisite hockey, boring hockey and effective hockey, but never had they played winning hockey through four playoff rounds, all the way to a grueling, glorious end.

title: Sweden, Northern Ireland, Love: Your Friday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Yes, Britain, You Can Have More Women on Corporate Boards
description: Welcome to Gender Letter  a weekly take on news, trends and culture by The Timess gender editor, Jessica Bennett. Want future installments delivered to your inbox? Sign up here. Tell us what you think at nytgender@nytimes.com.

title: I Wanted to Be Dominated. But Not Quite Like That.
description: Are you left- or right-handed? Dan asked, walking me down the subway steps.

title: Kerry Washington Is Going From the Beltway to Broadway
description: Scandal may have ended its seven-season run in April, but Kerry Washington carries on. She is teaming up with Steven Pasquale for the Broadway debut of Christopher Demos-Browns American Son, beginning in October. Kenny Leon will direct.

title: Steam, After Pulling School Shooter Game, Says It Will Sell Nearly Everything
description: Some of the titles recently available from the online video game marketplace Steam have names  like Suicide Simulator  that are fairly self-explanatory. Others have more innocuous titles that conceal the darker thrust of their game play: In the forthcoming Kindergarten, for instance, cartoon children are shot in the head by the school principal or hacked apart by the janitor.

title: Quotation of the Day: A 5-Year-Old Migrants Heartache: When Will I See My Papa?
description: His dad doesnt get to see him being joyful. Its as if these moments with his son have been stolen from him. I am no substitute.

title: Every Time I Thought the Purdue Pharma OxyContin Story Was Over, I Was Wrong
description: Times Insider delivers behind-the-scenes insights into how news, features and opinion come together at The New York Times.

title: Matt Lauer Can Keep New Zealand Ranch, Despite Inquiry Into Conduct
description: WELLINGTON, New Zealand  Matt Lauer, the former Today show co-host who lost his job over sexual misconduct allegations, will be allowed to keep his ranch in New Zealand, after a government agency said Friday it did not have sufficient evidence he had breached a good-character test for foreign property buyers.

title: Whats on TV Friday: Sense8 and Just Another Immigrant
description: Sense8 comes to a close. And Osamah Sami revisits his deceitful past in Alis Wedding.

title: While You Were Gawking at Snapchat Posts, One Artist Was Listening to Them
description: You might not have thought about Snapchat this way. You might not have thought much about it at all.

title: He Wants to Be a Ballerina. He Has Taken the First Steps.
description: The ladies of the court, wearing long dresses and hats with trailing veils, moved in a stately minuet across the stage of the Coliseum Theater in London on Wednesday night, in the English National Ballets production of The Sleeping Beauty. They tapped their canes on the floor as the Prince looked on, circling elegantly with uniform poise and charm.

title: How a Chinese Manuscript Written 2,300 Years Ago Ended Up in Washington
description: BEIJING  Sitting in an underground storeroom near the Washington Mall is a tiny silk parchment. Written 2,300 years ago, it is a Chinese version of the Dead Sea Scrolls, with text that swirls like the stars through the firmament and describes the relationship between humans and heaven.

title: The Uffizi Gallery Gathers Some Heavy Hitters in a New Room
description: FLORENCE, Italy  Last Sunday evening, soon after the final visitor had trickled out of the historic Palazzo Pitti, Eike Schmidt, the director of the Uffizi Gallery, gathered with other museum officials in the palaces main picture gallery. They were there to remove two of its most illustrious occupants: portraits that Raphael painted around 1504-1505.

title: News Quiz: Test Your Knowledge of the Weeks Headlines
description: Did you stay up to date this week?

title: U.S. Issues Alert to Americans in China in Wake of Sonic Attack Fears
description: BEIJING  The State Department issued a health alert on Friday to American citizens living or traveling in China, advising them to seek medical attention if they experienced auditory or sensory phenomena similar to those experienced by American diplomats evacuated to the United States.

title: Notes From the Book Review Archives
description: Penelope Lively reviews Michael Ondaatjes Warlight in this weeks issue. In 1992, Judith Grossman reviewed Ondaatjes most celebrated book, The English Patient, noting the Canadian writers distinctive, eloquent voice. Below is an excerpt.

title: Bill Cunninghams Unseen Scrapbooks
description: They are two thick, cardboard-bound books, their pages yellowed with age, their covers cracked and peeling. Between the two of them, they tell the story of 20 or so years in the life and work of William J., the society ladys hat maker who was  in the words of one of his own advertisements  The wildest! The maddest! The most fabulous!!!

title: How the Sculptor Diana Al-Hadid Spends Her Sundays
description: The artist Diana Al-Hadids first public commission in Madison Square Park, Delirious Matter, features six sculptures that probe how women have been depicted as objects of desire or purity throughout art history. Ms. Al-Hadid, 36, who was born in Aleppo, Syria, also has a 13-foot architectural piece from 2012, Nollis Orders, which will be on view starting July 18 at the Bronx Museum of the Arts. She lives in Prospect Heights, Brooklyn, with her husband, Jon Lott, 41, assistant professor of Architecture and director of the Master in Architecture I Program at Harvard University; their son, August, 2; Mr. Lotts son, Mason, 18; and their pet bunny, Mies (as in van der Rohe), a gift Mr. Lott pulled out of a hat and presented to Ms. Al-Hadid several years ago.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Shopping for a Car and a Teenagers Future
description: Eleven years ago, my life was changing, and I tried to stave off my anxiety about it by immersing myself in the search for the perfect stroller. Now Im doing the same thing, but this time the vehicle in question is a lot bigger and more powerful.

title: Honeymoons, Babymoons and Jobbymoons?
description: Last September, a week after leaving her job, Hirumi Nanayakkara did what any high-achieving and organized unemployed person would do: She woke up, ate breakfast and wrote a checklist. Instead of tasks like update LinkedIn or email recruiters, though, her to-dos included eat noodles, get a massage and go to the beach  exactly what one does while vacationing in the Balinese town of Padangbai.

title: Should Doctors Consider Body Size When Prescribing Drugs?
description: Q. Shouldnt doctors take into account body size when prescribing drugs? As a small female, I worry about getting the same dosage of antibiotics as men who weigh 100 pounds more than I do.

title: A Persian Turned Parisian Insists: Im Not an Immigrant, Im an Exile
description: DISORIENTAL By Negar Djavadi Translated by Tina Kover 338 pp. Europa Editions. Paper, $18.

title: Americas Next Great Running Hope, and One of the Cruelest Twists in Youth Sports
description: Its not clear exactly when a high school sophomore named Katelyn Tuohy became the next great phenom in American distance running.

title: The G-7 Summit: What to Watch For
description: President Trump is scheduled to depart for Canada on Friday morning for the annual G-7 summit meeting, a gathering of leaders of the United States and six of its main allies. But the two-day meeting comes at a fraught moment, with the American president locked in a bitter trade dispute with the other leaders over Mr. Trumps imposition of tariffs. Here are five things to watch:

title: Why Cities Cant Stop Poaching From One Another
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Near the bottom of the lengthy ballot San Francisco voters considered this week, in this state famous for its abundant and oddball ballot initiatives, Proposition I asked voters to establish a policy of not coveting other cities sports teams.

title: Your 20s Were Messy. Want to Talk About Them? We Do.
description: To many people just out of college, the endless, potentially life-changing decisions to be made every day can be overwhelming: Should I take this low-paying job to learn a new skill? Will I move for this relationship? How will I know when Ive figured it out?

title: Fluid Friendships: A Literary Ode to the Shifting Nature of Human Bonds
description: COMPANIONS By Christina Hesselholdt Translated by Paul Russell Garrett 408 pp. Fitzcarraldo Editions. Paper, $20.

title: Books Gone Wild
description: We asked creatures from around the ecosystem to tell us what theyre reading.

title: A Fable of Mozambique, Its Bloodshed and Myths
description: WOMAN OF THE ASHES By Mia Couto Translated by David Brookshaw 255 pp. Farrar, Straus & Giroux. $26.

title: The Struggles of Modern Motherhood in Essays, a Thriller and a Dystopian Novel
description: THE PERFECT MOTHER By Aimee Molloy 317 pp. Harper/HarperCollins. $27.99.

title: New in Paperback: Rising Star, Mrs. Fletcher
description: Six new paperbacks to check out this week.

title: Dangerous Disappearing Acts, With Killers in Pursuit
description: Theres no mistaking a John Connolly novel, with its singular characters, eerie subject matter and socko style. All these flags are flying in THE WOMAN IN THE WOODS (Emily Bestler/Atria, $26.99), which finds Charlie Parker, the oddball private detective in this quirky series, thwarted by the broken link in a chain of safe havens for battered women. Normally, they go in one end of the tunnel and come out the other, far away. Except when one of them is caught  someone like Karis Lamb, whose body is found in a shallow grave in the woods shortly after giving birth. Theres no sign of her newborn child.

title: Everything Is Copy
description: If you had your tonsils out, your cat would be happy to eat your tonsils, if you put them in her bowl. Thats probably not exactly what you expect to hear from an author flogging his book  unless that author is David Sedaris, whose new essay collection, Calypso, enters the list at No. 1. Sedaris finds inspiration in daily life  wearing a Fitbit, picking up trash, visiting his North Carolina beach house, the Sea Section. (He recently bought the house next door to the Sea Section, telling Money magazine, Were going to either call it the Amniotic Shack or Canker Shores.) In a lot of the stories nothing huge happens, Sedaris says. I spent a week at the beach with my family, but it wasnt like anybody got into a car accident or someone broke into the house and stole things. But it still felt like a story to me. You know, how life feels like a story.

title: How Christians Destroyed the Ancient World
description: THE DARKENING AGE The Christian Destruction of the Classical World By Catherine Nixey Illustrated. 315 pp. Houghton Mifflin Harcourt. $28.

title: Belmont Stakes 2018: Latest Odds, Picks and Contenders
description: The horses for the 150th running of the Belmont Stakes are listed in order of post position, with comments by Joe Drape and Melissa Hoppert of The New York Times. The morning-line odds were set by David Aragona of the New York Racing Association.

title: Marco Cecchinato Reaches a Milestone, Carrying a Match-Fixing Millstone
description: PARIS  Marco Cecchinato is basking in one of tenniss brightest spotlights this week, having reached the semifinals of the French Open in one of the bigger recent shocks in the mens game.

title: The Weekly Health Quiz: Weights, School and the Best Place to Live
description: Test your knowledge of this weeks health news.

title: From Cairo to Kolkata, Traces of a Vibrant Jewish Past
description: I spotted the front gates of the graveyard one morning on my way to Arabic class in downtown Tunis. Squished into a crowded metro car, I couldnt see clearly around the other passengers, but that Hebrew and Star of David were unmistakable.

title: Hey, Hey, Hey, Hey! Saved by the Bell Now a Restaurant
description: WEST HOLLYWOOD, CALIF.  When Eric Bushard, a 34-year-old senior manager of strategic partnerships at Yahoo, heard that a pop-up restaurant inspired by the TV series Saved by the Bell was opening here on Santa Monica Boulevard, he texted a friend he has known since the fourth grade, Hey Screech, it looks like the Max is open again!

title: Inside the Dollar Van Wars
description: The photographer Edu Bayer first noticed them on Flatbush Avenue in Brooklyn. Unmarked vans with tinted windows that slowed down and honked their horns. They were dollar vans  or commuter vans, as theyre officially known  fishing for customers.

title: New York City Gets a Little Greener
description: Developers are creating parkland along with their new apartment complexes.

title: New Parks Sprout Around New York
description: If New York appears a little greener this summer, it is no mirage.

title: Colbert Wants Trump to Prepare More for His Meeting With Kim Jong-un
description: Welcome to Best of Late Night, a rundown of the previous nights highlights that lets you sleep  and lets us get paid to watch comedy. If youre interested in hearing from The Times regularly about great TV, sign up for our Watching newsletter and get recommendations straight to your inbox.

title: Same Gun Was Used to Kill Two Critics of Hindu Nationalists in India
description: The gun that was used last year to kill a prominent journalist critical of the Indian government was the same weapon employed in the murder of a scholar with similar ideological leanings, the local news media said Friday, citing a forensic report.

title: LeBron James Is Carrying the Cavaliers in a Historic Way
description: During this seasons playoffs, James has accounted for nearly a third of his teams box-score statistics.

description: Traditionally, the departing president writes a personal letter to his successor, offering wisdom and best wishes. President Barack Obama duly left such a letter for President Trump, as President George W. Bush did eight years earlier.

title: Tightly Guarded, Singapore Battens Down for a Summit Meeting
description: SINGAPORE  For a couple of world leaders looking to get away to work on their relationship, Singapore has some obvious advantages.

title: She Wanted Lavish, He Was Fine With City Hall
description: The moment Chauncey Kearney broke out in a rash upon hearing the cost of flowers for his May 24 wedding was a moment of reckoning for his fiance, Chanet Tisdel.

title: Charm City: A Family Searches for Answers After a Fatal Police Shooting in Baltimore
description: A five-part audio series about a Baltimore teenager who was killed by the police and a grieving family still searching for answers.

description: If nature abhors a vacuum, politics abhors a military standoff, especially between two nations in one of the poorest, most volatile and most strategically sensitive regions of the world.

title: New York Today: 5 Reasons to Watch the Tonys
description: Good morning on this radiant Friday.

title: The Price of an Incompetent President
description: On Wednesday, five days after the official start of hurricane season in the Atlantic, Donald Trump attended what was supposed to be a meeting on storm preparedness at the Federal Emergency Management Agency headquarters. Most of the meeting was closed to the press, but The Washington Post obtained a recording.

title: The Age of the MSNBC Mom
description: My parents are empty-nesters, but a visit home feels crowded. There are Joe and Mika, flirtily bickering over breakfast. After dinner, Rachel holds forth like a beloved fictional boarding school teacher. Looking for a phone charger during the day, I walk past panels of ethics experts, muted and forgotten.

title: The Secret Life and Value of Trees
description: While we were obsessing over the self-obsessive one, people who take a much longer view of things have been debating the question of whether trees talk to one another, experience pain, have sex and send out signals of distress about the imminent collapse of this little planet of ours.

title: For Chinese Pedestrians Glued to Their Phones, a Middle Path Emerges
description: HONG KONG  So ubiquitous in China are pedestrians glued to their cellphones, they have earned a nickname: the heads-down tribe.

title: A Dream Wedding on a Budget
description: Jessica Goldblatt admits that Dreams on a Dime is a slightly misleading name for the San Francisco wedding planning business she founded in 2007. Its not a cut-rate service for couples who want a lavish event but cant pay full price. Its more about getting the biggest bang for your buck, she said. This would explain why a typical client spends about 500,000 dimes, or $50,000, on a wedding she is hired to orchestrate.

title: Charm City, Part 5: Whats Behind the Black Box?
description: The relatives of a Baltimore teenager think they know the name of the police officer who killed him. But when his mother finally sees the surveillance video of his death, a new story emerges.

description: Good Friday. Want this in your inbox every morning? Sign up here.

title: He Literally Wrote the Book on Fabulousness
description: BERLIN  At a vogue ball one recent Saturday night, the writer Madison A. Moore whipped out a red bamboo fan, stood up from his judges chair in his purple-teal sequined boots, and began feverishly fanning a contestant who was folding himself into a leg split on the floor of a Berlin theater.

title: Charm City, Part 5: Whats Behind the Black Box?
description: Nooks family thinks they know who killed him. But when the Baltimore police finally agree to show Toby the full surveillance video of his death, a new story emerges.

title: Anthony Bourdain, Renegade Chef Who Reported From the Worlds Tables, Is Dead at 61
description: Anthony Bourdain, whose darkly funny memoir about life in New York City restaurant kitchens made him a celebrity chef and touched off his second career as a journalist, food expert and social activist, was found dead on Friday in his hotel room in France. He was 61.

title: At Verizon, a Changing of the Guard as It Pursues 5G
description: The telecom giant Verizon said on Friday that it was installing its head of technology as chief executive. The changing of the guard comes at a time when the wireless industry as a whole is grappling with new technologies and a wave of consolidation.

title: World Cup 2026: How Each Country Voted
description: Heres how each soccer federation in FIFA voted on Wednesday.

title: This Week: Philharmonic Concerts in the Parks, Summer Jam, Alvin Ailey
description: The New York Philharmonic travels to the boroughs, Kendrick Lamar headlines the hip-hop festival and Alvin Ailey returns to Lincoln Center  plus four more events in the city you dont want to miss.

title: Why Will Power Could Not Contain Himself After Winning the Indianapolis 500
description: Will Power had won 33 open-wheel races and an IndyCar Series championship going into the Indianapolis 500 this year, but not the Indy 500 itself. He had driven in 10 Indy 500s, leading 67 laps and finishing as high as second in 2015, but he had also crashed twice and finished out of the top 10 three times.

title: Ahead of G-7 Summit Meeting, Trump Rails Against Canadian Tariffs
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump railed on Friday against Canadian tariffs on American dairy products as he prepared to travel to Canada, where he is likely to be greeted with an icy welcome ahead of a financial summit meeting with longtime American allies.

title: The G6+1
description: This article is part of the Opinion Today newsletter. You can sign up here to receive the newsletter each weekday.

title: You Have to Be Girl-Power Tough: Pageant Competitors Weigh In on Miss America
description: The Miss America Organization announced bold changes to its competition this week, including the end of the swimsuit contest. We are not going to judge you on your outward appearance, said Gretchen Carlson, a former Fox News anchor who was Miss America in 1989 and is now the organizations chairwoman.

title: Mens Fashion Week Loses Some Luster
description: LONDON  The mens wear calendar feels increasingly empty these days.

title: RuPauls Drag Race Season 10, Episode 11 Recap: Just Dont Stare
description: You are every human beings worst nightmare: a 43-year-old New York City divorce. You will never trust anyone again as long as you live. Resign yourself to using men like pool noodles until you are too old to bag them, which will be within the next six months. You will then trip on your toilet-paper-packed granny cart and die face-planted in the Brooklyn gutter. Now go make a dump cake and eat it over the sink while you listen to Hejira. Thats the only love youll ever feel!

title: California Today: This Is Not Your Grandfathers L.A.P.D.
description: Good morning.

title: Art Is Becoming a Financial Product, and Blockchain Is Making It Happen
description: LONDON  In recent years, there has been plenty of talk of the financialization of art. As prices soar to new levels and digital technology opens new markets, that talk is getting louder.

title: Trump Shakes Up World Stage in Break With U.S. Allies
description: WASHINGTON  Rarely has President Trumps role as a disrupter on the world stage been starker. At a moment of tumult over trade and nuclear security, he is shaking up the international order to make friends with Americas enemies and enemies out of Americas friends.

title: Kevin and Farhads Week in Tech: Did the Techlash Matter?
description: Each week, Kevin Roose, technology columnist at The New York Times, discusses developments in the tech industry, offering analysis and maybe a joke or two. This week, Farhad Manjoo, also a technology columnist, makes a return to the roundup as well. Want this newsletter in your inbox? Sign up here.

title: Get a Wi-Fi Tablet on a Cellular Network
description: Q. Since I connect to the internet with my phone using my data plan, I wonder if I could do the same with a tablet or laptop? Is it possible to get online with cellular data rather than Wi-Fi while on a tablet?

title: Tony Was a Symphony: Friends and Fans Remember Anthony Bourdain
description: Anthony Bourdains death by suicide on Friday prompted an outpouring of grief, with fellow celebrities, friends, foodies and fans paying tribute to a man who charmed many with his unvarnished, compassionate commentary on food and life.

title: The Game of Zones Guys Knew You Wanted a Bryan Colangelo Episode
description: Adam and Craig Malamut have created the funniest sports show on the internet, yet they cant explain why it is funny.

title: How to Treat the Severely Mentally Ill
description: To the Editor:

title: Being Ghosted By the Contractor
description: Dinnertime on a Sunday is not my favorite hour to discuss home-improvement projects with a prospective contractor, but there I was, eagerly showing this one my basement. I was willing to take what I could get. Of the three I called, he was the only one who showed up.

title: Kevin Costner Revisits the American West, Now by Helicopter
description: Few actors seem more to the saddle born than Kevin Costner. Onscreen, hes ridden the American frontier in Silverado, Open Range, Wyatt Earp and his Oscar-winning calling card, Dances With Wolves. Offscreen, he owns a 160-acre ranch in Aspen, Colo., and fronts a band called Modern West.

title: Caravaggio and Other Pleasures and Provocations for Pride Month
description: June is Pride Month  commemorating the gay rights movement that had its roots in the Stonewall uprising of June 1969 The streaming platforms FilmStruck and Fandor are offering special Pride Month programming. (Some titles in their programs are also available on the free-with-a-library-card streaming site, Kanopy, which, like Fandor, already maintains a commendable L.G.B.T. section year-round.)

title: Lisa Edelstein Says Goodbye to Her Girlfriends
description: For years, Lisa Edelstein was typecast as the best friend but never the leading lady.

title: The Pfizer Mansion in Clinton Hill
description: The 1887 brownstone was thoroughly renovated and restored by its current owners and is on the market for $13.5 million.

title: Clinton Hill Mansion With a Rock n Roll History
description: A ghost story led Jessica Warren to the house known as the Pfizer Mansion. A rock musician sold it to her.

title: In Dominic Thiem, Rafael Nadal Faces a New French Open Challenge
description: PARIS  On his favorite tennis court, Rafael Nadal was struggling on Friday. He looked hesitant and edgy, as if he might not be able to finish what he had started.

title: Baywatch Gets Its Game Face On
description: Put yourself in the position of the average person going to Jones Beach for the day, the photographer Joseph Szabo said the other day. You see the lifeguards on the stand, but theres certain things you dont see about them.

title: High School Musicians Take On the (Almost) Unplayable
description: Tensions are said to have run a bit high during the recording of the composer and saxophonist Anthony Braxtons pathbreaking, style-blending album Creative Orchestra Music 1976.

title: Trump Says Hes Considering a Pardon for Muhammad Ali
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump said on Friday that he is considering pardoning Muhammad Ali, a boxing legend who died two years ago and was convicted of refusing to be drafted during the Vietnam War. But it was not immediately clear what Mr. Trump sought to pardon, as Mr. Alis conviction was overturned nearly 50 years ago.

title: Trump Praises Arrest of Former Senate Committee Aide in Leaks Inquiry
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump on Friday praised the arrest of a former Senate Intelligence Committee aide who is accused of lying to investigators about his contacts with reporters in an inquiry into leaks of classified information.

title: Harry Potter Star Anthony Boyle, in 7 Instagram Posts
description: Four years ago he was a drama student in Wales. Now hes a Tony Award nominee for Harry Potter and the Cursed Child. Here the 24-year-old actor traces that path in his own words, with social media as a guide.

title: The Era of American Complacency on Trade Is Over
description: President Trump arrived at the Group of 7 summit meeting in Canada on Friday amid an expression of concern and disappointment from the six other nations finance ministers over United States trade policies. Conspicuously absent has been any acknowledgment by these ministers of the trade practices that contribute to Americas more than $500 billion annual global trade deficit in goods and services.

title: Couchsurfing With the Taliban
description: On April 19, a convoy of Canadian officials intercepted Joshua Adams, a 24-year-old counselor for homeless gay teenagers in Toronto, on a remote road in central Afghanistan. They tracked him down by following his Instagram account, where he had been posting images of himself drinking tea with the Taliban in Helmand.

title: The Deep Sea May Soon Be Up for Grabs
description: Monterey, Calif.  The rush to exploit the riches of the deep ocean and seafloor is beginning. As pollution, overfishing and climate change sap the productivity of surface waters, many countries and companies are scouting new territory deeper down. This presents a threat the deep ocean has never faced.

title: What to Cook This Weekend
description: Ill get to the recipes soon enough, to the joy and the happiness that the kitchen provides. But Anthony Bourdain is dead at 61, and its hardly a good morning at all. He was a toweringly good reporter and interviewer, a brilliant, caustic, funny writer, and Exhibit A in the argument that food and travel journalism is above all else journalism about culture. Bourdain knew that going places and eating things, asking questions all the while, would always be the best way to start telling the stories of the world.

title: Trump Says a Big Operation Kept Wife, Melania, From G-7
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump revealed new details on Friday about the closely guarded medical condition of Melania Trump, the first lady, saying that she underwent a four-hour operation and that her recovery would keep her from traveling abroad with him.

title: The Poetic Justice of Stella Abreras Juliet
description: The first time Stella Abrera stepped onto the stage with American Ballet Theater was in Romeo and Juliet. Granted, it wasnt the most glamorous part. She was a townswoman. Sweeping a broom.

title: Anthony Bourdain: The Man Who Ate the World
description: Anthony Bourdain understood that eating was simply a way of taking the world inside you.

title: KFC Will Test Vegetarian Fried Chicken, Original Herbs and Spices Included
description: LONDON  KFC says its cooking up a new, healthier recipe, one that will be missing the restaurant chains most famous ingredient: chicken.

title: Advice Has Changed on What Car to Buy for a Young Driver
description: If youre car shopping for a recent graduate, the traditional thinking about the best vehicle for new drivers has changed.

title: The Best, Worst and Scariest of This Weeks Movie Trailers
description: The calendar may say its not quite summer yet, but the summer movie season is in full swing. That means Hollywood is releasing a slew of trailers to run before all of the would-be blockbusters. This week alone, weve seen more than a dozen major previews.

title: Mourning Anthony Bourdain, a Culinary Explorer
description: To the Editor:

title: 3 New Novels on the Perils of Digital Life
description: HOW FAR SHES COME By Holly Brown 416 pp. Morrow/HarperCollins. Paper, $15.99.

title: Move Over, China: U.S. Is Again Home to Worlds Speediest Supercomputer
description: The United States just won bragging rights in the race to build the worlds speediest supercomputer.

title: Chicken Milanese Has Its Moment
description: Its an excellent moment for cutlets Milanese.

title: Austria Closes 7 Mosques and Seeks to Expel Imams Paid by Turkey
description: BERLIN  Chancellor Sebastian Kurz of Austria on Friday ordered the closing of seven mosques and the scrutiny of the right of dozens of Turkish imams to remain in the country, citing suspected violations of an Austrian law that bans political Islam or foreign financing of Muslim institutions.

title: A Florida City Wants More Retirees, and Is Going After Them
description: In Florida, one city is not waiting for retirees to show up but is recruiting them to resettle there.

title: Homer A. Neal, Leader in Physics Who Explored Matter, Dies at 75
description: Homer A. Neal, a physicist who helped shape education for physics undergraduates nationwide and led teams that took part in the hunt for the fundamental particles of matter, died on May 23 in Ann Arbor, Mich. He was 75.

title: To Conduct Its Parks Concerts, the Philharmonic Taps a Rising Star
description: A conductors first reaction to being offered an outdoor summer concert with an orchestra is often, well, no. The repertory is usually boring; the weather tends to be sweltering; no one in the audience pays attention, anyway. There are more prestigious gigs.

title: Bursts of Work, and Lots of Movement
The Insatiable and Unknowable Anthony Bourdain
description: Anthony Bourdain devoured the world. Thats not hyperbole. Its not even metaphor. There was no place that he wasnt curious to explore, no food that he wasnt determined to try, no cap on his hunger and no ceiling, or so it always seemed, on his joy.

title: Trump Attends G-7 with Defiance, Proposing to Readmit Russia
description: LA MALBAIE, Quebec  President Trump aggressively confronted Americas closest allies on Friday as they convened their annual summit meeting, calling for Russias readmission to the Group of 7 nations and refusing to ease his assault on the global trading system.

title: A Salad That Goes With the Grain
description: When you hear the word salad, a bowl of dressed lettuce or other greens may come to mind. On the other hand, chicken salad, tuna salad and potato salad dont necessarily imply anything green and leafy. And a juicy tomato salad is usually mostly tomatoes, with garlic and herbs added.

title: Rebel in the Kitchen: Remembering Anthony Bourdain
description: The former chef turned writer and TV host exposed the underbelly of restaurant culture and took viewers on far-flung culinary adventures with biting wit and a worldly outlook.

title: Trump Doing Brexit? A Very Good Thought, Says Britains Top Diplomat
description: LONDON  After surviving the latest round of infighting in her divided cabinet, Prime Minister Theresa May of Britain was in a good enough mood to speak to reporters after she boarded her plane to the Group of 7 summit meeting in Canada, late Thursday.

title: A Little Bit of a Nut Case Whos Taking On China
description: PANGANDARAN, Indonesia  Susi Pudjiastuti was scooping up lunch with one hand, using her thumb and two fingers to extricate bones from a chunk of fish. With the other hand, she simulated grinding a stiletto heel into the ground.

title: Portraying 18th-Century Black Men in Colonial Williamsburg
description: Jeremy Morris, 30, plays the roles of 18th-century black men at Colonial Williamsburg in Williamsburg, Va.

title: Ira Berlin Is Dead at 77; Groundbreaking Historian of Slavery
description: Ira Berlin, a historian whose research and acclaimed books helped reveal the complexities of American slavery and its aftermath, died on Tuesday in Washington. He was 77.

title: Requiem for the Irrepressible Mayor of West 83rd Street
description: Many blocks in New York City have their own local neighborhood fixture who inevitably gains the unofficial title of mayor and can sometimes give an otherwise anonymous street the feel of a small town.

title: Anthony Bourdain Was a Teller of Often Unappetizing Truths
description: Anthony Bourdain entered the literary stage with an inside tip, delivered in the gruff whisper of a racetrack tout: Dont order fish on Mondays.

title: Blue-Chip Artists and a Retiring Publisher
description: Benefits for MoMA, Brooklyn Botanic Garden, National Trust for Historic Preservation. Plus a retirement party for Arthur Sulzberger Jr.

title: Decades Later and Far Away, Chernobyl Disaster Still Contaminates Milk
description: LONDON  More than three decades after the Chernobyl nuclear disaster in Ukraine, cows far from the accident site still produce milk with dangerous levels of radiation, children still drink it and the problem could persist for decades to come, researchers reported on Friday.

title: The Ascension of Cauliflower
description: For Gail Becker, a former marketing executive who has two sons with celiac disease, finding gluten-free pizza that her kids could enjoy has long been a challenge.

title: Lawyers Ask ICE to Stop Deportation of Delivery Man
description: In an 11th-hour attempt to prevent the deportation of the undocumented pizza delivery man arrested at an Army base in Brooklyn last week, lawyers for the man filed a stay with the New York field director of Immigration and Customs Enforcement on Friday.

title: Flooding the Swamp
description: To the Editor:

title: LeBron James Reveals an Injury, but His Destination Is Far From Clear
description: CLEVELAND  The biggest revelation we got from LeBron James after what might have been the final game he ever plays for the Cleveland Cavaliers had nothing to do with his pending free agency. It was health-related.

title: Review: Pulled Apart by Love and Intrigue
description: If Shakespeares Romeo had lived into adulthood and kept his rebellious streak, he might have been something like Ferdinand Von Walter, the suitor in Friedrich Schillers Love and Intrigue. Lets hope hed have turned out better, though.

title: Setting the Stage for Trump and Kim
description: To the Editor:

title: The Playlist: Kanye Wests Breakout Star 070 Shake, and 10 More New Songs
description: Every Friday, pop critics for The New York Times weigh in on the weeks most notable new songs and videos  and anything else that strikes them as intriguing. Just want the music? Listen to the Playlist on Spotify here (or find our profile: nytimes). Like what you hear? Let us know at theplaylist@nytimes.com and sign up for our Louder newsletter, a once-a-week blast of our pop music coverage.

title: Chinas ZTE, Saved by U.S., Has a Checkered Past and Shaky Future
description: BEIJING  The Chinese electronics maker ZTE has survived its brush with death. Now it has to figure out how to stay in business.

title: Charlotte Fox, 61, Trailblazing Alpinist and Everest Survivor, Dies
description: Charlotte Fox, who climbed to dizzying heights as the first American woman to conquer three 26,000-foot or higher mountains and once defied a freak blizzard as she descended Mount Everest, died on May 24 in Telluride, Colo. She was 61.

title: Michael Pollan on His Acid Test
description: Michael Pollan talks about How to Change Your Mind, and Edward Tenner discusses The Efficiency Paradox.

title: Michael Pollan on Drugs
description: Subscribe: iTunes | Google Play Music

title: Mueller Adds Obstruction Charge on Manafort and Indicts His Right-Hand Man
description: WASHINGTON  After months of oblique references to an unnamed Russian associate of Paul Manafort, President Trumps former campaign chairman, the special counsel identified the associate on Friday and charged both men with obstruction of justice.

title: Trump Considers Pardoning Muhammad Ali, Whose Conviction Was Already Overturned
description: Mr. Trump, speaking to reporters on Friday.

title: Showing Up, and More, at the Mayors Fund
description: To the Editor;

title: Trump Says Hes Likely to Back Marijuana Bill, in Apparent Break With Sessions
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump appeared to break with his own administrations policy on Friday, saying that he was likely to support a legislative proposal to leave the decision to states about whether to legalize marijuana.

title: When Unpaid Training Doesnt Feel Voluntary at All
description: Send your workplace conundrums to workologist@nytimes.com, including your name and contact information (even if you want it withheld). The Workologist is a guy with well-intentioned opinions, not a professional career adviser. Letters may be edited.

title: A Clueless Fans Guide to the World Cup
description: Its World Cup time again  time for those remaining Americans who do not yet dress their children in FC Barcelona jerseys to become overnight experts on a subject that will sneak its way into even the least athletic conversations in the coming month.

title: Charles Krauthammer: I Have Only a Few Weeks Left to Live
description: Charles Krauthammer, the longtime columnist for The Washington Post, said in a statement published on the newspapers website on Friday that he is battling cancer and has only a few weeks left to live.

title: Listen to Dear Sugars: Trust Your Body  With Hilary Kinavey & Dana Sturtevant
description: Whats really to blame when you fall off of a diet plan? The Sugars Advise.

title: Can One Suicide Lead to Others?
description: The death of famed chef Anthony Bourdain, who apparently killed himself in a hotel room in France, caps a week of unnerving news about suicide.

title: My Not-So-Bad Birth Defect
description: I was born without a pectoral muscle. Its the right pectoralis major. My right, that is. Between my pale skin and my ribs is, well, practically nothing.

title: Would a Single-Payer System Require Painful Sacrifices From Doctors?
description: Single-payer health care systems deliver better outcomes at much lower cost than those that rely primarily on private insurance, as we do in the United States.

title: Robert Mandan, Philandering Husband on Soap, Dies at 86
description: Robert Mandan, a character actor best known for playing the lascivious stockbroker Chester Tate four decades ago on the ABC sitcom Soap, has died. He was 86.

title: Why Is Guatemalas Volcano Deadlier Than Hawaiis?
description: Henry Fountain, a climate reporter at The New York Times, breaks down the differences between the two recent eruptions and what we can expect to see.

title: Anheuser-Busch to Pull Funding From Major Alcohol Study
description: Brewing giant Anheuser-Busch InBev, one of five alcohol companies underwriting a $100 million federal trial on the health benefits of a daily drink, is pulling its funding from the project, saying controversy about the sponsorship threatens to undermine the studys credibility, the company announced Friday.

title: Why Guatemalas Volcano Has Been More Deadly Than Hawaiis
description: The recent volcanic eruptions in Hawaii and Guatemala are a reminder that not all volcanoes are created equal: Some types pose a far greater hazard to life than others.

title: 1 U.S. Soldier Is Killed and 4 Are Wounded in Somalia Firefight
description: WASHINGTON  An American Special Operations forces soldier was killed and four others were wounded on Friday in an attack in southwestern Somalia against fighters for the Islamic extremist group the Shabab, three Defense Department officials said. The casualties were the first to have been publicized in Africa since an ambush in Niger in October.

title: Balancing the Benefit and the Burden of Wealth
description: So much for that old saw that money cant buy happiness. A new survey of people who have built significant wealth on their own found that money has actually bought them a lot of happiness.

title: New York-Chicago Direct Train Shuts Down for First Time in Over a Century
description: The train route between New York City and Chicago was once the apex of luxury travel: Passengers boarded after walking on a red carpet laid out on the platform and nibbled lobster Newburg on fine china in the dining car.

title: Anthony Bourdain Talks to Frank Bruni
description: Anthony Bourdain, award-winning author, TV host and former chef, talks to Frank Bruni of The New York Times during a TimesTalks in 2009.

title: Jerry Hopkins, Biographer of Jim Morrison, Is Dead at 82
description: Jerry Hopkins, a first-generation music writer for Rolling Stone magazine whose many books included biographies of Jim Morrison, Elvis Presley and Jimi Hendrix  as well as a memoir of his affair with a transgender prostitute  died on June 3 in a hospital in Bangkok. He was 82.

title: Pilot for Game of Thrones Prequel Will Be Made by HBO
description: So, howd those White Walkers get their start? HBO viewers may soon find out.

title: Nick Cave Wants You to Work It Out on the Dance Floor
description: The Soul Train line appeared out of nowhere, fully formed, like it was meant to be. At the Park Avenue Armory on Wednesday night, dozens of dancers paired off to spin and bounce, sashaying between 40-foot-high glittering curtains.

title: Cosmetics Retailer Lush Drops Campaign Against Undercover British Police
description: LONDON  Visiting an outlet of the cosmetics retailer Lush is not for the faint of heart. Its stores are stocked with strongly scented ointments and brightly colored blocks of soap, and its advertisements are unapologetically strident when it comes to social issues.

title: Clarice Lispectors Second Novel Charts a Womans Existential Awakening
description: In 1943, a 23-year-old Brazilian journalist who loved Katherine Mansfields fiction and Baruch Spinozas philosophy published a debut novel that was unlike anything Brazilian literature had ever seen. Near to the Wild Heart was the worlds first reckoning with Clarice Lispectors brilliant, demanding, tempestuous prose, and it established her as a writer who  as we say these days  was going places. So it was a surprise, to Lispector as much as anyone, when three years later her second novel, The Chandelier, had trouble finding a publisher and received very little comment, even from reviewers who had loved her first. To this day, it remains her least written-about novel, often dubbed her most difficult, and now it gets a new superlative: the last to be translated into English.

title: Orange County Fights Turning Blue. And the Resistance Is Formidable.
description: HUNTINGTON BEACH, Calif.  California has dug in at the front lines of the resistance to President Trump, suing to overturn his environmental policies, passing legislation to hamstring his immigration enforcement and marching in mass demonstrations of defiance.

title: A Girls Killing Shakes Germanys Migration Debate
description: It was a gruesome murder: A 14-year-old girl was raped and strangled, her body buried under brushwood in a secluded area near the railway tracks near her hometown in western Germany.

title: June Is Bustin Out All Over: The Week in Classical Music
description: Even as orchestra and opera seasons wrap up, the classical music world is hardly slowing down. The week began with news that Fabio Luisi would succeed Jaap van Zweden as music director of the Dallas Symphony Orchestra. Another conductor, James Gaffigan, is getting a high-profile gig at the podium of the New York Philharmonics parks concerts this month.

title: A Quixotic Hunt for Mammoth Creatures That Ends in Tragedy
description: WEST By Carys Davies 160 pp. Scribner. $22.

title: A Debut Novel Where Nostalgia Softens Taboo Sex
description: DEMI-GODS By Eliza Robertson 230 pp. Bloomsbury. $26.

title: How the Hockey Team in Las Vegas Won Despite Losing
description: LAS VEGAS  To the usual assortment of tourists and hawkers on the Strips pulsing fantasy land of fountains, hotels, casinos, clubs and restaurants came thousands of hockey fans on Thursday night, heading to the T-Mobile Arena to see the hometown Golden Knights maybe, just maybe, improbably, win the Stanley Cup.

title: Why the Forced Error Does Not Get Its Due in Tennis
description: PARIS  The ultimate contradiction in tennis is the unforced error.

title: Moscow Theater Rebels, Husband and Wife, Are Dead
description: MOSCOW  In the early 2000s, Mikhail Ugarov and Elena Gremina, playwrights who were husband and wife, were lamenting that Russian theater had grown ossified and distant from societys problems a decade after the fall of the Soviet empire.

title: As the Public Mourns Anthony Bourdain and Kate Spade, These Books May Shed Some Light on Their Experiences
description: This week, the deaths of two beloved figures  celebrity chef Anthony Bourdain and American handbag designer Kate Spade  prompted widespread conversations about what leads to suicide, and the tolls of depression and emotional pain. Here, three books that explore these questions.

title: The Best of Anthony Bourdain
description: The chef, television host and author Anthony Bourdain was found dead on Friday at 61. CNN, the network on which his TV show Parts Unknown aired, said that he killed himself in a hotel in France, where he was working on an episode. He left his mark in restaurant kitchens and libraries  both fiction and nonfiction  and redefined the genre of food-tourism shows.

title: Why Cooks Loved Anthony Bourdain
description: OAKLAND, Calif.  I was introduced to Anthony Bourdain in 1999, at dinner at the home of the author Paula Wolfert. Not him, exactly, but his writing. It was late in the meal, the table covered with empty plates and wine bottles, when Ms. Wolfert suddenly jumped up and ran out of the room. She returned with the current copy of The New Yorker and started reading out loud from his now-legendary story Dont Eat Before Reading This, in which he detailed the realities of a professional kitchen with gallows humor and scientific precision. It was electric. No one on the inside had ever written about professional kitchens in such an honest and open way.

title: Warriors, in Full Dynasty Mode, Sweep Cavaliers in N.B.A. Finals
description: The Golden State Warriors were not perfect. They lost 24 games during the regular season. Rather than chase records, they endured injuries and bouts of complacency. Their path to the N.B.A. finals was more Appalachian Trail than autobahn. It took work, which might sound ridiculous, given their lavish roster.

title: Pixar Co-Founder to Leave Disney After Missteps
description: LOS ANGELES  John Lasseter, the animation titan who has been on leave from the Walt Disney Company following complaints about unwanted workplace hugging, will not return to the conglomerate.

title: G-7, Manafort, Bourdain: Your Friday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Ex-Officer Who Killed Student While Driving Drunk Is Freed
description: Four months in jail and community service is the penalty a former New York City police officer has ended up paying for killing a 22-year-old student last year in a drunken-driving accident in Queens.

title: Judge Denies Trumps Secrecy Claim in Review of Cohen Documents
description: Striking a note for transparency, a federal judge ruled on Friday that President Trump and his longtime personal lawyer, Michael D. Cohen, cannot proceed in total secrecy as they weigh in on the final stages of a laborious review of a huge trove of materials seized from Mr. Cohen during a series of raids by the authorities in April.

title: New Jersey Teacher Leaves Students $1 Million Gift in Her Will
description: The $1 million check came as a surprise.

title: At Gaza Protests: Kites, Drones, Gas, Guns and the Occasional Bomb
description: NAHAL OZ, Israel  The last Friday of Ramadan again brought thousands of Palestinians to the fence that separates the Gaza Strip from Israel for a day of peaceful protests, or violent riots, depending on which side you support in the conflict. For me, it was a chance to see things the way Israeli soldiers do.

title: How Suicide Quietly Morphed Into a Public Health Crisis
description: The deaths of the designer Kate Spade and the chef Anthony Bourdain, both of whom committed suicide this week, were not simply pop culture tragedies. They were the latest markers of an intractable public health crisis that has been unfolding in slow motion for a generation.

title: Frieze Fair Put a Price on High Heat. It Was Met With a Lawsuit.
description: How much are a few beads of sweat worth? Frieze New York, the mega art fair that takes place annually on Randalls Island, has an answer.

title: Ex-C.I.A. Officer Is Convicted of Spying for China
description: WASHINGTON  A former C.I.A. case officer faces life in prison after he was convicted on Friday of betraying his country to spy on behalf of China.

title: No, the Broadway Musical Isnt Doomed
description: Its the run-up to Tony Award time, and entrenched Broadway wags are once again raising their voices in unison, singing the same old reprise, taking it up a key with each chorus: The Broadway musical is doomed, hopelessly degraded by the devolution of its subject matter.

title: Tell Them I Was Not Afraid
description: HAMBURG, Germany  For years Raya Mazins slim memoir sat on my shelf unread, the sort of book familial duty prevents you from throwing out and emotional dread keeps you from reading. Rayas life had been an eventful one. It began in 1919 in the Latvian port of Liepaja, also known as Libau, and ended in Israel nearly 96 years later. In between came the Holocaust.

title: Decades Ago, New York Dug a Moat Around Its Specialized Schools
description: In New Yorks ragged history of race, class, privilege and equity, the citys specialized high schools have long been proxies. For some, they are the ideal of meritocratic opportunity, incubators of working-class genius and talent; others see their admissions policies as the picture of monumental injustice, as Mayor Bill de Blasio described them this month in Chalkbeat.

title: Can the Grammys Be Fixed?
description: Big stars didnt show up. Ratings were down. Hip-hop was once again shut out of the major categories. Can musics biggest night represent whats really happening in music?

title: Chinese Hackers Steal Unclassified Data From Navy Contractor
description: WASHINGTON  China has stolen sensitive data related to naval warfare from the computers of a Navy contractor, American officials said on Friday, in another step in the long-running cyberwar between two global adversaries.

title: Before the Smiles, Mounting Tensions Between Trudeau and Trump
description: LA MALBAIE, Quebec  Hours before President Trump landed in Canada on Friday, 18-year-old allegations that Justin Trudeau once groped a reporter resurfaced on a website sympathetic to the president.

title: The People Behind the Horse at Camp Justify
description: When Justify, the hulking chestnut colt with the big white blaze and the sweeping stride, tries to become the 13th Triple Crown winner on Saturday at Belmont Park, there will be no one rooting harder for him to race into the record books than the people on his team.

title: Press Groups Criticize the Seizing of a Times Reporters Records
description: The revelation that federal prosecutors seized years worth of email and phone records from a New York Times reporter drew criticism on Friday from news organizations and press rights groups, which expressed outrage at the first known instance of the Trump administrations pursuing the private communications of a journalist.

title: Trumps New Plan to Dismantle Obamacare Comes With Political Risks
description: WASHINGTON  After failing to repeal the Affordable Care Act with a Republican-controlled Congress, the Trump administration is seizing on a different strategy for dismantling the law, one fraught with political risk. It is asking a court to throw out major elements, including hugely popular provisions that protect sick people from being denied health insurance or charged higher rates.

title: What the Mets Need Now: Some Yankees-Style Boldness
description: Part of baseballs allure is that so little works out as planned. With so many players and variables, the game delights in smashing preconceived narratives. Consider the fate of the New York teams, who met at Citi Field on Friday. The Bronx is up and the Mets are way down.

title: Anthony Bourdain Was the Kind of Bad Boy We Need More Of
description: When Anthony Bourdain visited the San Francisco Bay Area in 2015 for his CNN show Anthony Bourdain:Parts Unknown, he made a point of sitting down for a meal with one of the founders of the Black Panther Party, Bobby Seale. And he didnt just talk about the food. He provided viewers an astute history of the group, its important role in the black freedom movement and the African-American community, and its suppression by the government.

title: The Secret Story of Salt and Vinegar Chips: the Canada Letter
description: Lets review what Canadians woke up to on Friday:

title: If Theres a Red Wave Election in 2018, This Will Be Why
description: PHOENIX   As primaries roll by and the midterms approach, its worth remembering that for Republicans 2016 represented an opportunity more than a victory. It was a chance for them to help the country break the 30-year-spell the Clintons and the Bushes cast, President Barack Obama notwithstanding.

title: Easier Drug Approval Isnt Cutting Drug Prices
description: Dr. Scott Gottlieb, the commissioner of the Food and Drug Administration, recently vowed to bring new science to market faster, in hopes that patients benefit from treatment advances sooner.

title: Kyrie Irving Doesnt Know if the Earth Is Round or Flat. He Does Want to Discuss It.
description: Kyrie Irving, the point guard for the Boston Celtics, is a dazzling basketball player, one of the best in the world. On this, there is very little debate  and certainly not from me, a lifelong Celtics fan. His ability to creatively dribble the basketball is so singular that The Boston Globe found last year that video game makers had trouble duplicating it.

title: Unalloyed
description: SATURDAY PUZZLE  Before I begin, I want to mention that we understand the need for a convenient link back to the main Wordplay page, which was lost when we changed systems. We are working on bringing it back to the Wordplay label at the top of the column. That may take a while, though, so for the time being, that link will be at the beginning of each column, where it tells you which days puzzle were discussing.

title: Quotation of the Day: Anthony Bourdain, Renegade Chef, Dies at 61; Showed the World How to Eat Without Fear
description: He taught us about food  but more importantly, about its ability to bring us together. To make us a little less afraid of the unknown.

title: The Biggest Stories in American Politics This Week
description: President Trump, unusually isolated and at odds with his counterparts, arrived Friday in Canada for an annual summit meeting with some of the United States closest allies. Before he left Washington, he raised the prospect of welcoming Russia back into the Group of 7 and he  vowed not to back down on tariffs.

title: Corrections: June 9, 2018
description: INTERNATIONAL

title: Yankees Win Opener Against the Mets, as Masahiro Tanaka Scores a Painful Run
description: In this Mets season headed sideways, Jacob deGrom represents a glimmer of hope. One of the best starting pitchers in baseball over the past several years, he has taken his work on the mound to another level this season. Even against the juggernaut of the Yankees lineup, deGrom was a capable foe.

title: Whats on TV Saturday: American Made and I Want That Wedding
description: Tom Cruise plays a smuggler in American Made. And engaged couples get a dose of reality in I Want That Wedding.

title: Justice Dept. Wont Defend DACA in Texas-Led Lawsuit
description: The Justice Department late Friday night responded to Texas request for an injunction in its challenge of the Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals program, agreeing with the state and several others that the program is unlawful.

title: Taliban Announce Brief Cease-Fire, Offering Afghans Hope for Lull in War
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  In a move that could inject life into a long-struggling Afghan peace process, the Taliban announced Saturday that they would halt operations against Afghan forces for the three days of the Muslim festival Eid al-Fitr.

title: 30 Billion Gallons of Hawaiian Lava, as Seen From the Ground and Space
description: Since the Kilauea volcano first erupted on May 3, fissures ripped open and lava wiped out several square miles of property.

title: First Canada Tried to Charm Trump. Now Its Fighting Back.
description: The Canadians could see the trouble looming in the summer of 2016. Chrystia Freeland, Canadas trade minister at the time, found herself, along with millions of Canadians, fixated on the unfolding United States presidential election, and it was becoming impossible to overlook the gathering clouds of protectionism. Donald Trump and Hillary Clinton were each casting aspersions upon Nafta as if it were self-evidently a bad deal for American workers, especially for the hollowed-out working and middle classes in the Midwestern states, like Ohio and Michigan, that would decide the election. Incredibly, at least according to Trump, Americas seemingly benign and milquetoast northern neighbor was an economic predator taking advantage of its nave neighbor; America was the victim and Canada the villain.

title: What Is the Trade Deficit?
description: This is an updated and expanded version of an article published in 2016.

title: How Good Is the Trump Economy, Really?
description: The Trump administration has become downright boastful about the state of the economy.

title: Grazing an Entire Country at a Mexico City Market
description: The best time to visit Mercado Roma Coyoacn  the new three-floor food hall made up of 42 different vendors in the Mexico City neighborhood of Coyoacn  is during a televised soccer game. As the scent of simmering pork and just-heated corn tortillas lingered in the air, the cries of gooooooaaaaallll! from the various TVs echoed through the space as patrons fist-pumped and high-fived each other.

title: This Device Helps Fish Make It Out of the Twilight Zone Alive
description: In the ocean, sandwiched between sun-filled shallows and ever-darker depths, is a strange place where the noon sun shines only as bright as twilight.

title: Mark Zuckerberg, Elon Musk and the Feud Over Killer Robots
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Mark Zuckerberg thought his fellow Silicon Valley billionaire Elon Musk was behaving like an alarmist.

title: At a London Hotel, Art Deco Design and Stylish Cocktails
description: From around 250 pounds, or $333

title: When the Noises from Upstairs Are Worrisome
description: Q: Every night, I hear loud sounds coming from the apartment above mine in my large Midtown co-op. I hear banging and screaming, and it sounds as though it may be sexual. Not only does it keep me up, but it also worries me. What if its not consensual? I dont know how to deal with this, as it is embarrassing. Do I confront my neighbor? Or alert the doorman or management? How do I handle this situation?

title: 11 of Our Best Weekend Reads
description: When bright stars are dimmed, as was the case this week with the deaths of two leaders in their fields, we sometimes turn to other worlds for comfort. The World Cup, John Coltrane and a little Broadway bonanza come to mind. Here is some of our best journalism of the week to keep you going.

title: The Albino Community in Ghana: Im Motivated to Believe That I Can Survive
description: ACCRA  When Bernice Agboada was 15 years old, she dropped out of high school because she couldnt see the blackboard. The humiliation of walking to the front of the class to see what her teacher was writing was exacerbated by constant ridicule from her classmates. Two years later, she returned to school and began to pay someone to take notes for her.

title: Listen to Dear Sugars: Trust Your Body  With Hilary Kinavey & Dana Sturtevant
description: Her doctor categorized her as overweight when she was 5 years old. Her grandmother always introduced her as the chubby one. As an adult, she vacillates between moderation and binge-eating, restricting food some weeks, and gorging on cake and ice cream during others. Its only when my pants are nearly impossible to button that I force myself to lose weight, writes the letter-writer who calls herself Body Negative. And then the pattern starts all over again.

title: A Teens Death in Baltimore and a Familys Search for Answers
description: BALTIMORE  As soon as I heard Davetta Parkers voice, I knew I had to meet her. Her grandson, Nook, was one of seven young people from one high school killed in the spasm of violence that swept the city in the two years after the 2015 death of Freddie Gray. I had cold-called her from New York. When she picked up, she was sitting at her desk in the central branch of Baltimores public library system, where she works.

title: The Rich Are Planning to Leave This Wretched Planet
description: HOUSTON  In an era in which privileged individuals search constantly for the next experience to obsess over and post about on social media, space truly remains the final frontier, a luxury that only the one percent of the one percent can afford. Brad Pitt and Katy Perry are among those who have reportedly plunked down $250,000 for a ride on one of Richard Bransons Virgin Galactic spaceships, undaunted by a 2014 test flight that crashed and killed one pilot.

title: Pope Tells Oil Executives to Act on Climate: There Is No Time to Lose
description: ROME  Three years ago, Pope Francis issued a sweeping letter that highlighted the global crisis posed by climate change and called for swift action to save the environment and the planet.

title: A Sense of Adventure, Whether Near or Far
description: Caitlin Stuart Richardson and Jeffrey Stephen Cangialosi were married June 9 at DeMaranville Farm and Gardens, an events space in Saratoga Springs, N.Y. Dona Ann McAdams, a Universal Life minister, officiated.
